text: Your brain uses about 20% of your body's total energy despite being only 2% of your body weight.
Your stomach gets a completely new lining every 3-4 days to prevent it from digesting itself.
The human eye can distinguish about 10 million different colors.
You produce about 25,000 quarts of saliva in your lifetime — enough to fill two swimming pools.
Your bones are 4 times stronger than concrete, but they're also constantly being broken down and rebuilt — your entire skeleton is replaced every 10 years.
The acid in your stomach is strong enough to dissolve metal, but a mucus layer protects your stomach lining from digesting itself.
Humans are bioluminescent — we glow in the dark, but the light is 1,000 times weaker than what our eyes can detect.
Your heart will beat about 3 billion times in your lifetime and pump enough blood to fill an oil tanker.
The smallest muscle in the human body is the stapedius in the ear, while the largest is the gluteus maximus.
You lose about 4 kg of skin cells every year — most household dust is actually dead human skin.
The human nose can detect over 1 trillion different scents, but it becomes nose-blind to familiar smells after just a few breaths.
Every person has a unique tongue print, just like fingerprints.
The human body contains enough iron to make a 3-inch nail, enough carbon to make 900 pencils, and enough fat to make 7 bars of soap.
Your blood vessels, if laid end to end, would circle Earth more than twice — about 60,000 miles.
The cornea is the only part of the body with no blood supply — it gets oxygen directly from the air.
Humans can distinguish between at least 1 trillion different smells, far more than the 10,000 previously estimated.
Your body produces enough heat in 30 minutes to boil half a gallon of water.
The focusing muscles in your eyes move about 100,000 times a day — to give your legs the same workout, you'd have to walk 50 miles.
Babies are born with 300 bones, but adults only have 206 because many fuse together as we grow.
Your liver performs over 500 different functions including filtering 1.4 liters of blood per minute.
The average person walks the equivalent of 5 times around the Earth in their lifetime.
Human teeth are as strong as shark teeth, but shark teeth are designed to be continuously replaced.
You are taller in the morning than at night because gravity compresses your spine during the day by about 1 cm.
The strongest muscle in the human body relative to its size is the masseter (jaw muscle), which can close your teeth with up to 200 pounds of force.
When you blush, the lining of your stomach also turns red.
The human sneeze can travel at over 100 mph and expel 100,000 germs.
You have no sense of smell when you're sleeping, which is why smoke detectors were invented.
The enamel on your teeth is the hardest substance in the human body, harder than your bones.
Your eyes can detect a candle flame from 1.6 miles away in perfect darkness.
The width of your arm span is roughly equal to your height.
Crying emotional tears is unique to humans — no other animal sheds tears due to feelings.
The human eye has such high resolution that if it were a digital camera, it would have 576 megapixels.
Your small intestine is about 20 feet long, but the villi and microvilli give it a surface area the size of a tennis court.
The liver is the only organ that can completely regenerate — you can donate half your liver and it will grow back to full size.
The longest hiccuping spree lasted 68 years — Charles Osborne hiccuped from 1922 to 1990.
